result.execSummary:
The defendant Edgar Eduardo Ramirez Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Edgar Eduardo Ramirez Garcia in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant has paid up front restitution. 
   The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count #1:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

60 DAYS JAIL; (concurrent to Count #2 and 14CT2009)

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS;

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*No Use or Possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription;
*Defendant not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. 
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  Kayla G.
*DNA sample/surcharge: Waived.

RESTITUTION:  Paid in full.

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (apply cash bail);

CONDITION TIME: 30 DAYS, Non working hours with standard release conditions including release for treatment, counseling, education. Defendant to report to the Huber Facility by 7:00 p.m. on Wednesday, May 25, 2016.   

Count #2:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

6 MONTHS JAIL;
 (concurrent to Count #1 and 14CT2009)

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS;

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*No Use or Possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription;
*Defendant not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. 
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  
Kayla G.
*DNA sample/surcharge: Waived.

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (apply cash bail and balance to be refunded to poster);

  Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
Sentencing hearing on May 18, 2016 at 11:00 am.
